powermetering.eli5: It’s like a smart ruler that tells how much electricity your devices are using.
powermetering.boss: Power metering is the process of measuring real-time energy usage to enable smarter decisions and automations.
powermetering.sysadmin: Power metering uses current transformers or shunt resistors to measure voltage, amperage, and power (W, Wh, kWh) for IoT monitoring.
powermetering.use_case: Used to track energy use from large appliances like washers or HVAC systems.

powerconsumption.eli5: Power consumption is how much juice your gadgets use while they run.
powerconsumption.boss: Power consumption refers to the amount of energy used by a device or system, useful for monitoring efficiency.
powerconsumption.sysadmin: It is measured in watts (W) or kilowatt-hours (kWh), often reported by smart plugs, sensors, or energy panels.
powerconsumption.use_case: Used to identify power-hungry devices and reduce overall energy bills.

overtheairotaupdates.eli5: It’s like sending a new brain to your device without plugging anything in.
overtheairotaupdates.boss: OTA (Over-the-Air) updates deliver firmware or software improvements wirelessly to smart home devices.
overtheairotaupdates.sysadmin: OTA updates use Wi-Fi or Zigbee/Z-Wave management protocols to patch or upgrade device firmware securely over the network.
overtheairotaupdates.use_case: Used to improve a device’s security or add features without removing it from service.
